original: @72b // pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa'i man ngag bzhugs /
analyzed: @72b // pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa'i man ngag bzhugs /
translated: Instruction on the Stages of Meditation in the Pāramitā Vehicle

original: # // pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa'i man ngag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽gang zhig bsgoms stobs kyis yongs rdzogs //
analyzed: # // pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa'i man ngag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo // gang zhig bsgoms stobs kyis yongs rdzogs //
translated: Homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: tshogs gnyis kyi ni rgyur gyur pa //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis kyi ni rgyur gyur pa //
translated: The cause for the perfection of the two accumulations🔽through the power of meditation

original: sangs rgyas nyid la yang dag brtan //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la yang dag brtan //
translated: is the attainment of buddhahood.

original: bsgom pa'i skal dang mi ldan pa //🔽de'i phyir 'gro ba'i mgon po yis //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i skal dang mi ldan pa // de'i phyir 'gro ba'i mgon po yis //
translated: Those who lack the fortune to meditate🔽on the path of the perfections

original: shes rab zhi gnas bsgom pa gsungs //🔽de ni brtse chen rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: shes rab zhi gnas bsgom pa gsungs // de ni brtse chen rdzogs byang chub //
translated: are taught the meditation on wisdom and śamatha🔽by the protector of beings.🔽This is the cause for the generation in the mindstream of beings

original: 'gro ba'i rgyud la skyed byed yin //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyud la skyed byed yin //
translated: of great compassion and perfect awakening.🔽The cause for the perfection of the two accumulations🔽through the power of meditation🔽is the attainment of buddhahood.

original: gang yang bsgoms pa'i stobs las nges par 'byung ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes gnyis kyi rgyu /
analyzed: gang yang bsgoms pa'i stobs las nges par 'byung ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes gnyis kyi rgyu /
translated: Those who lack the fortune to meditate🔽on the path of the perfections🔽are taught the meditation on wisdom and śamatha🔽by the protector of beings.🔽This is the cause for the generation in the mindstream of beings🔽of great compassion and perfect awakening.

original: kun tu bzang po nyid la rgyun mi 'chad par mngon par brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas dus yun ring po mi thogs par rdzogs pa mngon sum du byed la /
analyzed: kun tu bzang po nyid la rgyun mi 'chad par mngon par brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas dus yun ring po mi thogs par rdzogs pa mngon sum du byed la /
translated: The yogi/nī who is constantly and uninterruptedly striving for the state of Samantabhadra will, without delay, perfect the direct realization of the state of Samantabhadra.

original: de byed pa'i skal pa med pa de rnams kyi phyir thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'i mgon pos zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'jug pa'i lam nye bar @73a * //🔽bstan pa mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: de byed pa'i skal pa med pa de rnams kyi phyir thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'i mgon pos zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'jug pa'i lam nye bar @73a * // bstan pa mdzad pa yin te /
translated: For those who do not have the good fortune to do that, the Lord, who possesses great compassion, has taught the path of the union of śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: de ltar na de bsgoms pas bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab mngon sum du byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar na de bsgoms pas bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab mngon sum du byas nas /
translated: Thus, having meditated in that way and actualized the Bhagavatī Prajñāpāramitā,

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i dngos po'i thabs la bslabs pa las sangs rgyas nyid du mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i dngos po'i thabs la bslabs pa las sangs rgyas nyid du mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: one should train in the method of the activities of generosity and so on that are of the nature of the Bhagavatī. It is the intention that one will then manifestly accomplish buddhahood.

original: de yang snying rje chen po skyes nas byang chub kyi sems bskyed la /
analyzed: de yang snying rje chen po skyes nas byang chub kyi sems bskyed la /
translated: Moreover, having given rise to great compassion, one should give rise to the mind of awakening.

original: de nyid gong nas gong du rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i tshul gyis rnam par rtog pa spongs pas yongs su dag pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sgom par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid gong nas gong du rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i tshul gyis rnam par rtog pa spongs pas yongs su dag pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sgom par byed do //
translated: He cultivates the perfection of meditative absorption by means of the method of abandoning discursive thought, in order to generate the purity that comes from abandoning discursive thought.

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pas ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis 'di dag thams cad nyid sdug bsngal rnams las bton la /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pas ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis 'di dag thams cad nyid sdug bsngal rnams las bton la /
translated: He generates the thought of awakening, thinking, “I will rescue all these beings from suffering, because I am filled with great compassion and I am pained by the suffering of others.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes byang chub kyi sems skyed par byed cing 'di rnams kyang dam bcas pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i dngos po'i thabs la bslab pa med par de gong nas gong du yongs su dag pa med par rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes byang chub kyi sems skyed par byed cing 'di rnams kyang dam bcas pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i dngos po'i thabs la bslab pa med par de gong nas gong du yongs su dag pa med par rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: I will definitely lead them to buddhahood.” He thinks, “Without the method of training in the nondual wisdom that is the essence of the vow and the means of the thing to be done, which is generosity and so on, it will not be perfected, and it will not become increasingly pure.”

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'jug pa'i lam yang sgom par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus te bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'jug pa'i lam yang sgom par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus te bstan pa yin no //
translated: And in order to perfect nondual intuition, they cultivate the path of the union of calm and insight. This is the brief teaching.

original: byang chub kyi sems de yang rnam pa du zhig ce na /🔽smras pa / byang chub sems gang gzhan don du //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de yang rnam pa du zhig ce na / smras pa / byang chub sems gang gzhan don du //
translated: How many kinds of Thought of Enlightenment are there?🔽It is said:

original: yang dag byang chub 'dod pa yin //🔽de ni dbye ba gnyis kyis gnyis //
analyzed: yang dag byang chub 'dod pa yin // de ni dbye ba gnyis kyis gnyis //
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment is the desire for perfect enlightenment for the sake of others.🔽It is twofold, according to its differentiation as promise and performance.

original: de dag nyi shu gnyis su 'ang 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag nyi shu gnyis su 'ang 'gyur //
translated: It is also twenty-two-fold, according to its differentiation in the stages.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni smon pa'i sems dang 'jug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni smon pa'i sems dang 'jug pa'i sems so //
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment is the aspirational thought and the engaged thought.

original: de yang sdong po bkod pa las /
analyzed: de yang sdong po bkod pa las /
translated: And in the Gandavyuha:

original: rigs kyi bu sems can gyi tshogs ni gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems rnyed par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems can gyi tshogs ni gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems rnyed par dka' ba'o //
translated: Son of noble family, it is difficult for a multitude of sentient beings to find the Thought of Enlightenment which is the supreme, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: de bas kyang sems can bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la mngon par zhugs pa de ni ches rnyed par dka'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas kyang sems can bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la mngon par zhugs pa de ni ches rnyed par dka'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is even more difficult to find a sentient being who has entered into the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gnyis po de dag kyang rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis su dbye ba bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis po de dag kyang rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis su dbye ba bya ste /
translated: These two are divided into twenty-two types.

original: de yang 'phags pa byams pas /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa byams pas /
translated: Maitreya explains:

original: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
analyzed: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
translated: Earth, gold, moon, fire,

original: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
analyzed: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
translated: treasure, jewel mine, ocean,🔽diamond, mountain, medicine, friend,

original: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
analyzed: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
translated: wish-fulfilling gem, sun, song,

original: rgyal @73b po mdzod dang lam po che //🔽bzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
analyzed: rgyal @73b po mdzod dang lam po che // bzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
translated: king, treasure, highway,🔽vehicle, flowing river,

original: sgra snyan chu bo sprin rnams kyis //
analyzed: sgra snyan chu bo sprin rnams kyis //
translated: musical instrument, river, and cloud.

original: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: These are the twenty-two types.

original: de la yang 'di ltar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la yang 'di ltar blta bar bya ste /
translated: They should be viewed in the following way:

original: 'dun pa'i gnas skabs stsogs dbye bas //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i gnas skabs stsogs dbye bas //
translated: The stages of aspiration and so on are divided

original: smon pa'i sems ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: smon pa'i sems ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: into three types of aspirational mind.

original: 'jug pa zhes ni bya ba'i sems //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes ni bya ba'i sems //
translated: The mind called engaged

original: rnam pa bcu dgu dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu dgu dag tu 'dod //
translated: It is held that there are nineteen kinds of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de la smon pa'i sems rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: de la smon pa'i sems rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: Therein, the Thought of Enlightenment of aspiration is threefold,

original: 'dun pa dang lhan cig 'dres pa'i chos thams cad mngon par byang chub par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can ni sa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang lhan cig 'dres pa'i chos thams cad mngon par byang chub par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can ni sa lta bu yin no //
translated: the one having the nature of the desire for the full enlightenment of all things, which is mixed with aspiration, is like the earth,

original: bsam pa dang lhan cig 'dres pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan nyid de /🔽phyis 'byung ba dang da ltar gyi 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir gser bzang po lta bu yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa dang lhan cig 'dres pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan nyid de / phyis 'byung ba dang da ltar gyi 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir gser bzang po lta bu yin no //
translated: the one mixed with the intention is the one having the nature of the six perfections,

original: lhag pa'i sems dang 'dres pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can des dkar po'i phyogs thams cad 'phel bar 'dod pa'i tshul gyis zla ba tshes pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems dang 'dres pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can des dkar po'i phyogs thams cad 'phel bar 'dod pa'i tshul gyis zla ba tshes pa lta bu yin no //
translated: and the one mixed with the superior mind is the one having the nature of the desire to cultivate the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, and it is like the waxing moon, by the method of the desire for the increase of all that is good.

original: 'jug pa'i sems kyi dbye ba ni rnam pa bcu dgu ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sems kyi dbye ba ni rnam pa bcu dgu ste /
translated: The classification of the Thought of Enlightenment of engagement is nineteenfold,

original: sbyor ba dang 'dres pa gcig dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang 'dres pa gcig dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang ldan pa dang /
translated: The first is the stage of preparation, the second is the stage of union, the third is the stage of the ten perfections such as generosity, the fourth is the stage of the superknowledges, the fifth is the stage of merit and intuition, the sixth is the stage of the factors of enlightenment,

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa dang / gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa dang / chos kyi skyed mos tshal dang ldan pa dang / bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang ldan pa dang / chos kyi sku dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa dang / gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa dang / chos kyi skyed mos tshal dang ldan pa dang / bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang ldan pa dang / chos kyi sku dang ldan pa'o //
translated: the seventh is the stage of calm and insight, the eighth is the stage of retention and eloquence, the ninth is the stage of the garden of Dharma, the tenth is the stage of the path of one way, and the eleventh is the stage of the Dharma body.

original: 'di yis de dag ma lus khyab //
analyzed: 'di yis de dag ma lus khyab //
translated: All of these are pervaded by these perfections.

original: de bas gnas skabs rnam bzhi ste //
analyzed: de bas gnas skabs rnam bzhi ste //
translated: Therefore, there are four stages:

original: 'bras bu rgyu dang sbyor sogs dang // lam gyi gnas skabs dbye bas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang sbyor sogs dang // lam gyi gnas skabs dbye bas so //
translated: The stage of result, the stage of cause, the stage of union, and the stage of path.

original: de la gsum ni las dang po pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de la gsum ni las dang po pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The first three are the stage of the beginner.

original: bzhi pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The fourth is the stage of the factors of enlightenment.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sems kyis ni rgyu'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sems kyis ni rgyu'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The thought of the perfections such as giving, etc. is the causal state.

original: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang lhan cig gnas pa brgyad kyis ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs khyab pa yin no //🔽de la dang po mgon po yis //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang lhan cig gnas pa brgyad kyis ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs khyab pa yin no // de la dang po mgon po yis //
translated: The eight abodes together with the state of the superknowledges, etc. are the pervaded state of the result.🔽The first of these is the thought of supplication

original: gsol ba'i rnam pa yang dag bshad //🔽gnyis pa sbyin sogs la 'jug pa //
analyzed: gsol ba'i rnam pa yang dag bshad // gnyis pa sbyin sogs la 'jug pa //
translated: which is well explained by the Lord.🔽The second is the thought of engagement

original: 'jug pa'i rnam pa rab tu bsgrags //🔽gsol ba'i sems @74a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam pa rab tu bsgrags // gsol ba'i sems @74a * //
translated: in giving, etc. which is proclaimed as the aspect of engagement.

original: kyi rnam pa ni gsum ste de yang sngar bshad pa yin no //🔽'jug pa'i rnam pa ni gang nas brtsams te /
analyzed: kyi rnam pa ni gsum ste de yang sngar bshad pa yin no // 'jug pa'i rnam pa ni gang nas brtsams te /
translated: The thought of supplication has three aspects, and these have already been explained.

original: sdom pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro bas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs la 'jug pa ni 'jug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: sdom pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro bas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs la 'jug pa ni 'jug pa'i sems so //
translated: The thought of engagement is that from which one begins to engage in the collection of giving, etc. preceded by the taking of the vow.

original: sdom pa yang bla ma sdom pa la gnas shing mkhas pa nus pa dang ldan pa las blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa yang bla ma sdom pa la gnas shing mkhas pa nus pa dang ldan pa las blang bar bya'o //
translated: The vow should be taken from a guru who is established in the vow, is learned, and has ability.

original: de med na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mdun du bzhugs par yid la byas la blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de med na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mdun du bzhugs par yid la byas la blang bar bya'o //
translated: If that is not present, one should imagine that the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are present in front and take the vow in their presence.🔽And that is stated:

original: de yang / sbyin sogs shes rab dang bral ba //
analyzed: de yang / sbyin sogs shes rab dang bral ba //
translated: Giving, etc. without wisdom

original: thabs ma yin zhing sa ma yin //
analyzed: thabs ma yin zhing sa ma yin //
translated: is not the method, not the ground.

original: de bas shes rab bskyed bya zhing //
analyzed: de bas shes rab bskyed bya zhing //
translated: Therefore, one should generate wisdom

original: zhi gnas kyang ni bskyed par bya //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyang ni bskyed par bya //
translated: and also generate serenity.

original: shes rab med pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi thob cing thabs kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab med pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi thob cing thabs kyang ma yin no //
translated: Without wisdom, giving, etc. do not obtain the name “perfection” and are not the method.

original: de bas na shes rab skyed pa'i phyir dang zhi gnas bskyed par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab skyed pa'i phyir dang zhi gnas bskyed par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should strive to generate wisdom and to generate serenity.🔽And that is stated:🔽One who is moral, able to endure pain,

original: de la / gang zhig khrims ldan sdug bsngal bzod nus dang // gang la brtson dang bag yod brtan pa 'chang //
analyzed: de la / gang zhig khrims ldan sdug bsngal bzod nus dang // gang la brtson dang bag yod brtan pa 'chang //
translated: who is persevering, heedful, and steadfast,

original: gang tshe yang dag dang yang ldan gyur te //
analyzed: gang tshe yang dag dang yang ldan gyur te //
translated: when endowed with right view

original: de yi ting 'dzin myur du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi ting 'dzin myur du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur //
translated: quickly perfects his concentration.

original: zhi gnas kyi tshogs tshul khrims la sogs pa gsum la gnas pas yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyogs su stan bde ba la 'dug ste lus drang por bzhag la /🔽snying rje chen po mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi tshogs tshul khrims la sogs pa gsum la gnas pas yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyogs su stan bde ba la 'dug ste lus drang por bzhag la / snying rje chen po mngon sum du byas te /
translated: By abiding in these, one sits on a comfortable seat in a solitary place.

original: sems can ma lus pa gdon par 'dod pa'i bsam pas sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa gdon par 'dod pa'i bsam pas sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya'o //
translated: One then generates the samādhi that has the characteristic of a one-pointed mind, having actualized great compassion and the intention to liberate all sentient beings without exception.

original: de la man ngag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la man ngag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The instruction for this is as follows.

original: khams sogs dbye ba dngos po thams cad la //
analyzed: khams sogs dbye ba dngos po thams cad la //
translated: All things are classified into elements and so forth.

original: yang dag dmigs de ji srid mnyam gzhag thob //
analyzed: yang dag dmigs de ji srid mnyam gzhag thob //
translated: As long as one has not attained meditative equipoise, one should focus the mind on those objects.

original: de srid yid ni skad cig re re gzhug / dang por re zhig rnal 'byor pas khams la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i dbye bas dngos po ma lus pa rgya cher rnam par dpyad la /
analyzed: de srid yid ni skad cig re re gzhug / dang por re zhig rnal 'byor pas khams la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i dbye bas dngos po ma lus pa rgya cher rnam par dpyad la /
translated: To begin, the practitioner should extensively analyze all things by means of the categories of elements and so forth.

original: chos thams cad ni 'di tsam du zad do zhes de ltar nges par bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'di tsam du zad do zhes de ltar nges par bya ste /
translated: One should ascertain that all phenomena are nothing more than this.

original: yang sems kyi rgyun gyi skad cig mas de nyid du gtad par bya'o //
analyzed: yang sems kyi rgyun gyi skad cig mas de nyid du gtad par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the mind should be fixed on that very object by the momentariness of the stream of mind.

original: gal te yid ni chags sogs kyis g-yengs gyur //
analyzed: gal te yid ni chags sogs kyis g-yengs gyur //
translated: If the mind is distracted by attachment, etc.,

original: mi gtsang la sogs gnyen por bsgom pa yis //
analyzed: mi gtsang la sogs gnyen por bsgom pa yis //
translated: by the cultivation of the remedy, such as the contemplation of the impurities, etc.

original: ji srid de ni brtan pa ma thob pa //
analyzed: ji srid de ni brtan pa ma thob pa //
translated: As long as one does not attain stability,

original: de srid blo dang ldan pas de zhi bya //
analyzed: de srid blo dang ldan pas de zhi bya //
translated: the wise one should pacify it.

original: yang gang gi tshe bar skabs su 'dod chags la sogs pas sems g-yengs par gyur pa de'i tshe mi gtsang ba bsgom pa la sogs pas rnam par g-yengs pa zhi bar byas la @74b sems yang nas yang du de la gong nas gong du gtad par bya'o //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe bar skabs su 'dod chags la sogs pas sems g-yengs par gyur pa de'i tshe mi gtsang ba bsgom pa la sogs pas rnam par g-yengs pa zhi bar byas la @74b sems yang nas yang du de la gong nas gong du gtad par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, when the mind is distracted by attachment, etc., at some point, one should pacify the distraction by the cultivation of the contemplation of impurities, etc., and again and again fix the mind on that object, higher and higher.🔽Then, the Blessed One taught in the Mother, the Great

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po las 'dod chags rnam pa dgu ni chen po nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po las 'dod chags rnam pa dgu ni chen po nyid du bstan te /
translated: Perfection of Wisdom, that there are nine degrees of attachment.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dbyibs la chags pa dang / reg pa la chags pa dang / tsandan la sogs pas bskus pa las byung ba'i lus kyi dri la chags pa dang / rgyan gyis brgyan pa las byung ba'i lus mdzes pa la chags pa dang / lus kyi kha dog la chag pa dang /
analyzed: dbyibs la chags pa dang / reg pa la chags pa dang / tsandan la sogs pas bskus pa las byung ba'i lus kyi dri la chags pa dang / rgyan gyis brgyan pa las byung ba'i lus mdzes pa la chags pa dang / lus kyi kha dog la chag pa dang /
translated: Attachment to shape, attachment to contact, attachment to the smell of the body arising from anointing with sandalwood paste, etc., attachment to the beauty of the body arising from adornment with ornaments, attachment to the color of the body,

original: sha rgyas pa la chags pa dang / lus dang yan lag gi rtse 'jo la chags pa dang / so mdzes pa las byung ba'i chags pa dang / kha dog dang dbyibs la chags pa'o //
analyzed: sha rgyas pa la chags pa dang / lus dang yan lag gi rtse 'jo la chags pa dang / so mdzes pa las byung ba'i chags pa dang / kha dog dang dbyibs la chags pa'o //
translated: attachment to the plumpness of the body, attachment to the playfulness of the body and its limbs, attachment arising from beautiful teeth, and attachment to color and shape.

original: de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i mi gtsang ba yang rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i mi gtsang ba yang rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: The remedy for that is the nine kinds of impurity.

original: de ni 'di lta ste /🔽dbyibs la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes so //🔽lus kyi reg pa la chags pa'i ni 'bus gzhig pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: de ni 'di lta ste / dbyibs la chags pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes so // lus kyi reg pa la chags pa'i ni 'bus gzhig pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: They are as follows:🔽The perception of a bloated corpse is the remedy for attachment to shape.🔽The perception of a corpse eaten by worms is the remedy for attachment to the contact of the body.

original: lus kyi dri la chags pa'i ni rnam par rul pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: lus kyi dri la chags pa'i ni rnam par rul pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The perception of a stinking corpse is the remedy for attachment to the smell of the body.

original: lus mdzes pa la chags pa'i ni rnam par dmar ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: lus mdzes pa la chags pa'i ni rnam par dmar ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to attachment to the beauty of the body is the perception of a corpse as livid.

original: lus kyi kha dog la chags pa'i ni rnam par bsngos pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: lus kyi kha dog la chags pa'i ni rnam par bsngos pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to attachment to the body’s complexion is the perception of a corpse as livid and bloated.

original: sha rgyas pa la chags pa'i ni rnam par zos pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: sha rgyas pa la chags pa'i ni rnam par zos pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to attachment to the body’s flesh is the perception of a corpse as eaten.

original: lus dang yan lag gi rtse 'jo la chags pa'i ni rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: lus dang yan lag gi rtse 'jo la chags pa'i ni rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to attachment to the body’s limbs and joints is the perception of a corpse as scattered.

original: so mdzes pa la chags pa'i ni rus gong gi 'du shes so //
analyzed: so mdzes pa la chags pa'i ni rus gong gi 'du shes so //
translated: The antidote to attachment to the teeth is the perception of a skeleton.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs la chags pa'i ni rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes so //🔽zhe sdang las byung ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen por ni byams pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs la chags pa'i ni rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes so // zhe sdang las byung ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen por ni byams pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: The antidote to attachment to the body’s color and shape is the perception of a corpse as burned beyond recognition.🔽The antidote to distraction born of hatred is the cultivation of loving kindness.

original: gti mug las byung ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen por ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug las byung ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen por ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsgom pa'o //
translated: The antidote to distraction born of delusion is the cultivation of dependent origination.

original: gang gi sems de mngon par mi dga' bar mthong ba de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan la bsam pa dang mi dge ba'i skyon la bsam pa de yang zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi sems de mngon par mi dga' bar mthong ba de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan la bsam pa dang mi dge ba'i skyon la bsam pa de yang zhi bar bya'o //
translated: When he sees that his mind is not inclined to that, then he should pacify that thought of the virtues of concentration and that thought of the faults of the nonvirtuous.

original: yang gang gi gnyid dang mun pa las sems zhum par mthong ba de'i tshe snang ba'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pas sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan yid la byed pas zhum pa de yang zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang gang gi gnyid dang mun pa las sems zhum par mthong ba de'i tshe snang ba'i 'du shes bsgom pa dang rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pas sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan yid la byed pas zhum pa de yang zhi bar bya'o //
translated: Again, when he sees that his mind is slack due to sleep and darkness, then he should pacify that slackness by cultivating the perception of light and by keeping in mind the virtues of the Buddha, etc.

original: yang gang gi tshe sngon dgod pa dang rtse zhing dga' ba rjes su dran pas sems bar skabs su rgod par mthong ba de'i tshe /🔽mi @75a * //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe sngon dgod pa dang rtse zhing dga' ba rjes su dran pas sems bar skabs su rgod par mthong ba de'i tshe / mi @75a * //
translated: Again, when he sees that his mind is distracted in the middle by recollecting former laughter, play, and merriment,

original: rtag pa yid la byed pas de yang zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa yid la byed pas de yang zhi bar bya'o //
translated: then he should pacify that distraction by keeping in mind impermanence.

original: yang gang gi tshe zhum pa dang rgod pa dag dang bral ba nyid kyis cha mnyam par 'jug cing sems rang gi mtshan nyid kyis gnas par mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe zhum pa dang rgod pa dag dang bral ba nyid kyis cha mnyam par 'jug cing sems rang gi mtshan nyid kyis gnas par mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: Again, when he sees that his mind is engaged evenly, free from slackness and excitement, and is abiding in its own characteristic,

original: bsgrims pa dang klong pa btang snyoms su byas te /
analyzed: bsgrims pa dang klong pa btang snyoms su byas te /
translated: One should be neither tense nor loose, but equanimous.

original: gal te sems mnyam par 'jug tu bsgrims pa byas na /
analyzed: gal te sems mnyam par 'jug tu bsgrims pa byas na /
translated: If one is tense,

original: de'i tshe sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //🔽le lo dang ni dmigs par brjed pa dang // de bzhin zhum rgod mi rtsol ba dang rtsol //
analyzed: de'i tshe sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ro // le lo dang ni dmigs par brjed pa dang // de bzhin zhum rgod mi rtsol ba dang rtsol //
translated: then the mind becomes distracted.🔽Laziness, forgetting the object of meditation,🔽slackness, excitement,

original: ting nge 'dzin la thams cad nyes par 'gyur //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la thams cad nyes par 'gyur //
translated: non-exertion, and exertion are faults in meditative concentration.

original: dad sogs sems nyid de yi gnyen po yin //
analyzed: dad sogs sems nyid de yi gnyen po yin //
translated: Faith, etc. are the antidotes to those.

original: mdor na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nyes pa nyid ni rnam pa drug yod de /
analyzed: mdor na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nyes pa nyid ni rnam pa drug yod de /
translated: In brief, there are six faults in all meditative concentrations:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Laziness,🔽forgetting the object of meditation,🔽slackness,🔽excitement,🔽tension, and

original: le lo dang / dmigs pa brjed pa dang / zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang / bsgrims pa dang / ma bsgrims pa'o //
analyzed: le lo dang / dmigs pa brjed pa dang / zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang / bsgrims pa dang / ma bsgrims pa'o //
translated: looseness.

original: de rnams kyi gnyen por spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad bsgom par bya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnyen por spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad bsgom par bya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One taught that one should cultivate the eight antidotes to those.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽Faith,🔽striving,🔽pliancy,🔽effort,🔽mindfulness,🔽alertness,🔽equanimity, and🔽attention.

original: dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / btang snyoms dang / sems pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / btang snyoms dang / sems pa'o //
translated: Faith, will, effort, pliancy, mindfulness, awareness, equanimity, and volition.

original: de la dang po bzhi ni le lo'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: de la dang po bzhi ni le lo'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: The first four are antidotes to laziness.

original: de yang ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan rnams la yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dad pas rnal 'byor pa rnams de la mngon par 'dod pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yang ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan rnams la yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dad pas rnal 'byor pa rnams de la mngon par 'dod pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Faith, which has the characteristic of conviction in the virtues of samādhi, gives rise to a mind that longs for it.

original: mngon par 'dod pa las rtsol ba rtsom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa las rtsol ba rtsom par 'gyur ro //
translated: From longing, one undertakes effort.

original: de las kyang lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, one attains pliancy of body and mind.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa de las lus dang sems le lo las ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa de las lus dang sems le lo las ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: From that pliancy, body and mind turn away from laziness.

original: de bas na dad pa la sogs pa ni le lo spang ba'i phyir bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dad pa la sogs pa ni le lo spang ba'i phyir bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, faith and so on should be cultivated in order to abandon laziness.

original: dran pa ni dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Mindfulness is the antidote to forgetting the object of meditation.

original: shes bzhin ni zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: shes bzhin ni zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: Awareness is the antidote to laxity and excitation.

original: des zhum pa dang rgod pa dag nye bar shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des zhum pa dang rgod pa dag nye bar shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the recognition of laxity and excitement.

original: zhum pa dang rgod pa ma zhi ba'i dus su ni mi rtsol ba nyes pa yin te /
analyzed: zhum pa dang rgod pa ma zhi ba'i dus su ni mi rtsol ba nyes pa yin te /
translated: When laxity and excitement are not pacified, non-exertion is a fault.

original: de'i gnyen por ni sems bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por ni sems bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The remedy for that is to cultivate the mind.

original: zhum pa dang rgod pa de dag nye bar zhi bar gyur nas /
analyzed: zhum pa dang rgod pa de dag nye bar zhi bar gyur nas /
translated: When laxity and excitement are pacified,

original: gang gi tshe sems rang gi rgyun gyis 'jug pa de'i tshe ni rtsol ba nyes pa yin pas de'i gnyen por btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems rang gi rgyun gyis 'jug pa de'i tshe ni rtsol ba nyes pa yin pas de'i gnyen por btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
translated: when the mind engages by its own continuity, then exertion is a fault. The remedy for that is to cultivate equanimity.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed @75b brgyad po de yang dag par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni gang gi rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i yon tan rdzogs par byed par mchog tu las su rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed @75b brgyad po de yang dag par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni gang gi rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i yon tan rdzogs par byed par mchog tu las su rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The samādhi endowed with those eight formative forces of abandonment becomes supreme in its function of perfecting the qualities such as the superknowledges.

original: de bas na mdo las spang ba'i 'du byed brgyad dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mdo las spang ba'i 'du byed brgyad dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, a sūtra declares, “One cultivates the foot of spiritual practice that is the basis of supernormal power endowed with the eight formative forces of abandonment.”

original: bsgom pa'i rim pa 'di nyid la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das yum de nyid las de la sems mnyam par gzhag par bya /🔽yang dag par 'jog par byed /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rim pa 'di nyid la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das yum de nyid las de la sems mnyam par gzhag par bya / yang dag par 'jog par byed /
translated: With this very process of meditation in mind, the Transcendent Lord declared in the Mother Scripture:🔽“One should settle the mind,🔽one should thoroughly settle it,

original: rnam par 'jog par byed /🔽nye bar 'jog par byed /
analyzed: rnam par 'jog par byed / nye bar 'jog par byed /
translated: one should fully settle it,🔽one should settle it nearby,

original: dul bar byed /🔽zhi bar byed /
analyzed: dul bar byed / zhi bar byed /
translated: one should subdue it,🔽one should pacify it,

original: nye bar zhi bar byed /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar byed /
translated: one should thoroughly pacify it,

original: gcig pa nyid du byed /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du byed /
translated: one should unify it,🔽one should concentrate it.

original: ting nge 'dzin du byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that one should do this in meditative concentration.🔽🔽

original: yang dag par 'jog par byed pa ni dmigs pa de nyid la rgyun gyis 'jug par byed pa'o //🔽rnam par 'jog pa ni rnam par g-yeng bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'jog par byed pa ni dmigs pa de nyid la rgyun gyis 'jug par byed pa'o // rnam par 'jog pa ni rnam par g-yeng bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Thoroughly settling it is continuously engaging that very object.

original: de nye bar zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nye bar zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: Fully settling it is recognizing distraction and pacifying it.

original: nye bar 'jog par byed pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba nye bar zhi bar byas nas de nyid la gong nas gong du gtod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'jog par byed pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba nye bar zhi bar byas nas de nyid la gong nas gong du gtod par byed pa'o //
translated: Settling it nearby is, after pacifying distraction, focusing on that very object more and more.

original: dul bar byed pa ni dga' ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dul bar byed pa ni dga' ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Subduing it is generating joy.

original: zhi bar byed pa ni mi dga' ba zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhi bar byed pa ni mi dga' ba zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: Pacification is the pacification of displeasure.

original: nye bar zhi bar byed pa ni gnyid dang rmugs pa la sogs pa byung ba sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar byed pa ni gnyid dang rmugs pa la sogs pa byung ba sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Tranquilization is the removal of sleepiness, lethargy, etc.

original: gcig pa nyid du byed pa ni dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pa la 'bad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du byed pa ni dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pa la 'bad par byed pa'o //
translated: Unification is the effort to enter into the object without mental construction.

original: ting nge 'dzin du mnyam par 'jog pa ni sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa la btang snyoms su byed pas yang dag par 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du mnyam par 'jog pa ni sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa la btang snyoms su byed pas yang dag par 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even placement in samadhi is the correct retention of the mind through equanimity when it has attained evenness.

original: tshig dgu po 'di dag gi bshad pa ni slob dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa las bris pa yin no ;🔽/ yang rim pa 'dis ting nge 'dzin rdzogs par gang gi tshe 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tshig dgu po 'di dag gi bshad pa ni slob dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa las bris pa yin no ; / yang rim pa 'dis ting nge 'dzin rdzogs par gang gi tshe 'gyur zhe na /
translated: The explanation of these nine terms is taken from the master Asanga.

original: de'i tshe smras pa /🔽gang gi sems ni rtsol ba med pas ni //
analyzed: de'i tshe smras pa / gang gi sems ni rtsol ba med pas ni //
translated: At what point is the perfection of samadhi attained by this process?

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug par 'gyur ba na //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug par 'gyur ba na //
translated: When the mind enters its object spontaneously without effort,

original: de'i tshe sangs rgyas mnyam 'jog la brten te //
analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas mnyam 'jog la brten te //
translated: then, based on the even placement of the Buddha,

original: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul yin no //
translated: This is the method of meditative concentration.

original: gang gi tshe dmigs pa de la mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pas sems gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe zhi gnas rdzogs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dmigs pa de la mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pas sems gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe zhi gnas rdzogs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: When the mind becomes fixed on that object by engaging it without the need for any further effort, then one should understand that serenity has been achieved.

original: de ltar mnyam 'jog shes nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar mnyam 'jog shes nas ni //
translated: Having understood meditative equipoise in that way,

original: de nas shes par bskyed bya ste //
analyzed: de nas shes par bskyed bya ste //
translated: then one should generate knowledge.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med dbye ba yi //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med dbye ba yi //
translated: The meaning of the distinction between form and formlessness

original: don de nyid ni rnam dpyad bya //🔽de bas na rnam @76a * //
analyzed: don de nyid ni rnam dpyad bya // de bas na rnam @76a * //
translated: should be analyzed.🔽Therefore, by this analysis, since there is no conceptual proliferation, one should understand that beings have the nature of the Dharma body.

original: par dpyad pa 'dis spros pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba rnams chos sku'i bdag nyid du shes par byas la sems tsam las yongs su bzlas la gcig dang du ma nyid la sogs pa'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid kyang snang ba med pa'i tshul🔽gyis bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: par dpyad pa 'dis spros pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba rnams chos sku'i bdag nyid du shes par byas la sems tsam las yongs su bzlas la gcig dang du ma nyid la sogs pa'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid kyang snang ba med pa'i tshul🔽gyis bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Having transcended mere mind, one should also transcend reality by the method of nonappearance, by the method of singularity and multiplicity, and so forth.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba 'di nyid ni gang shes rab kyis rnam par brtags na yang dag pa'i ye shes mthong bas chos thams cad mi mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba 'di nyid ni gang shes rab kyis rnam par brtags na yang dag pa'i ye shes mthong bas chos thams cad mi mthong ba yin no //
translated: This seeing of reality is itself the seeing of the wisdom of the noble ones, which does not see any phenomena through the vision of correct wisdom.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyi yum bar ma las /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyi yum bar ma las /
translated: And that is stated in the middle-length Perfection of Wisdom Sutra:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes kyi spyan gang zhe na /🔽gang gis ci yang ma gzigs pa'i don de gzigs pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par mthong ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes kyi spyan gang zhe na / gang gis ci yang ma gzigs pa'i don de gzigs pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par mthong ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the wisdom eye of the bhagavān buddhas?🔽It is the seeing of the meaning of not seeing anything at all.”🔽And similarly, “What is seeing in the ultimate?

original: gang chos thams cad mthong ba med pa'o zhes ji skad du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad mthong ba med pa'o zhes ji skad du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is not seeing any phenomena.”

original: de bas na de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang spyod lam thams cad la gnas pa na /
analyzed: de bas na de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang spyod lam thams cad la gnas pa na /
translated: Therefore, even when yogins and yoginīs of suchness are abiding in all kinds of conduct,

original: chos thams cad mthong du zin kyang ma mthong ba len no //
analyzed: chos thams cad mthong du zin kyang ma mthong ba len no //
translated: they do not see any phenomena, even though they are seeing them.

original: de lta bu nyid mthong ba med pa zhes bya bar mngon par 'dod kyi gnyid log pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid mthong ba med pa zhes bya bar mngon par 'dod kyi gnyid log pa'am /
translated: They are called “not seeing suchness” and are not considered to be asleep.

original: mig btsums pa dang 'dra bar gang yid la mi byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig btsums pa dang 'dra bar gang yid la mi byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that one does not attend to anything at all, as if one were blind.

original: de lta na ni bag chags ma spangs pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa las ldang ba bzhin du slar yang gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba nyid
analyzed: de lta na ni bag chags ma spangs pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa las ldang ba bzhin du slar yang gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba nyid
translated: If that were so, then since the latent propensities would not be eliminated, one would again generate attachment and so on, which are rooted in the latent propensities of attachment to form and so on, just as when one rises from the meditative attainment of nonperception.

original: kyis rnal 'byor par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kyis rnal 'byor par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One would not be a yogi.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi gzugs la sogs par mngon par zhen pa yid la mi byed pa tsam gyis yongs su spangs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi gzugs la sogs par mngon par zhen pa yid la mi byed pa tsam gyis yongs su spangs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The mere nonattention to the attachment to form and so on that has existed since beginningless time would not eliminate it.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas kyang de spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas kyang de spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meditative attainment of nonperception and so on would also eliminate it.

original: gang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi the tshom spangs pa de yid la byed pa yongs su spangs par yang nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi the tshom spangs pa de yid la byed pa yongs su spangs par yang nus pa ma yin te /
translated: One who eliminates doubt about objects such as form is also able to eliminate attention.

original: me yongs su spangs pas tsha ba spong mi nus pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: me yongs su spangs pas tsha ba spong mi nus pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like not being able to avoid heat without avoiding fire.

original: de bas na the tshom gyi sa bon dang bral ba nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa bsal bar bya'i /
analyzed: de bas na the tshom gyi sa bon dang bral ba nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa bsal bar bya'i /
translated: Therefore, it is certain that one should remove attachment to form, etc. by being free from the seed of doubt,

original: tsher ma 'byin pa lta bur bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: tsher ma 'byin pa lta bur bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: and not like removing a thorn.

original: the tshom gyi sa bon dang bral bar bya ba yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong phan tshun rjes su mthun par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi sa bon dang bral bar bya ba yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong phan tshun rjes su mthun par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: And being free from the seed of doubt is to engage tranquility and insight in mutual harmony.

original: de yang sems rtse gcig pa'i @76b mtshan nyid can gyis zhi gnas skye bar gyur na shes rab kyi mig gis rnam par dpyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i the tshom dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang sems rtse gcig pa'i @76b mtshan nyid can gyis zhi gnas skye bar gyur na shes rab kyi mig gis rnam par dpyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i the tshom dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, when tranquility arises through the characteristic of one-pointed mind, the yogin who analyzes with the eye of wisdom becomes free from doubt.

original: de dang bral bas gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang bral lo //
analyzed: de dang bral bas gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang bral lo //
translated: By being free from that, he is free from attachment to form, etc.

original: de dang bral nas kyang chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs te de nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de dang bral nas kyang chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs te de nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Having been separated from that, one realizes that all phenomena are unreal, and that itself is the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang de'i tshe zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag de'i bdag nyid can yin te /
analyzed: yang de'i tshe zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag de'i bdag nyid can yin te /
translated: Moreover, at that time, śamatha and vipaśyanā are of the nature of that.

original: de nyid ni mchog tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni mchog tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: That itself is the yoga of supreme nonconceptuality.🔽It is said:

original: de yang / kun rtog thams cad spangs pa ste //
analyzed: de yang / kun rtog thams cad spangs pa ste //
translated: Abandoning all conceptions,

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor dam pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor dam pa yin //
translated: this is the sublime yoga.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang mngon sum du //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang mngon sum du //
translated: The yogi/nī who abides in direct perception

original: gnas pa kun mkhyen bcom ldan 'gyur //🔽de ltar rim pa 'dis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bdag gis sam /
analyzed: gnas pa kun mkhyen bcom ldan 'gyur // de ltar rim pa 'dis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bdag gis sam /
translated: becomes the omniscient Bhagavān.

original: bla ma'i man ngag gis bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab bskyed la /
analyzed: bla ma'i man ngag gis bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab bskyed la /
translated: In that way, by this process, one should generate the wisdom of the mother, the Bhagavatī, through śamatha and vipaśyanā, either by oneself or🔽through the instructions of a guru.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rab dang ldan pa yin na de nges pa'i rgyud nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin par rtogs par byas la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rab dang ldan pa yin na de nges pa'i rgyud nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin par rtogs par byas la /
translated: If the bodhisattva has the highest faculties, having ascertained the continuum of that, one should realize the state of irreversibility.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: One enters into the method of the perfections such as generosity, and into the essence of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de yang 'phags pa ga ya mgo'i ri las gnyis po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa ga ya mgo'i ri las gnyis po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: And in the noble Gṛdhrakūṭa, it is said that these two are included in the bodhisattva path:

original: 'di lta ste thabs dang / shes rab bo zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste thabs dang / shes rab bo zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: skill in means and wisdom.

original: thabs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshad med pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba ste /
analyzed: thabs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshad med pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba ste /
translated: Skill in means is distinguished by the divisions of the perfections such as generosity, the immeasurables, and the means of gathering.

original: de nyid kyang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa dang / dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa'i mdo las gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa dang / dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa'i mdo las gsungs so //
translated: And that is taught in the noble Akṣayamati, Ratnamegha, and other sūtras.

original: shes rab ni thabs de nyid phyin ci ma log par yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni thabs de nyid phyin ci ma log par yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Wisdom is the cause of unmistaken discernment of just that skill in means.

original: des kyang thabs yang dag par brtags nas phyin ci ma log pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don ji lta ba bzhin nyams su len pas sngags kyis zin pa'i dug spyod pa dang 'dra bar kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang thabs yang dag par brtags nas phyin ci ma log pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don ji lta ba bzhin nyams su len pas sngags kyis zin pa'i dug spyod pa dang 'dra bar kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Having examined the means correctly, one practices for one’s own and others’ aims without error, like a snake-handler handling a snake.

original: de yang mdo de nyid las thabs ni bsdu ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mdo de nyid las thabs ni bsdu ba shes pa'o //
translated: The same sūtra says, “The means is knowing how to gather.🔽Wisdom is knowing how to cut through.”

original: shes rab ni yongs su gcod pa shes pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa las /
analyzed: shes rab ni yongs su gcod pa shes pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa las /
translated: The noble Sūtra on the Postures for Sitting and so on says,

original: thabs la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is skill in means?

original: gang chos thams cad kyi bsdu ba shes pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi bsdu ba shes pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: It is the skill in knowing how to gather all dharmas.

original: shes rab gang zhe na /🔽gang chos thams cad dbyer @77a * //
analyzed: shes rab gang zhe na / gang chos thams cad dbyer @77a * //
translated: What is wisdom?

original: med pa shes pa la mkhas pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //🔽'di dag la ni sa la gnas pas kyang bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: med pa shes pa la mkhas pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o // 'di dag la ni sa la gnas pas kyang bsten par bya'o //
translated: It is the skill in knowing how to cut through all dharmas.”

original: shes rab tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: You should rely on both of these, not just wisdom alone.

original: gang gi phyir sa bcu pa la sogs pa'i mdo las pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams la yang mi spyod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pas byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu thams cad du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la kun tu spyad par
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bcu pa la sogs pa'i mdo las pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams la yang mi spyod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pas byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu thams cad du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la kun tu spyad par
translated: Because the Dashabhumika and other sutras say, “It is not that he does not practice the other perfections,” the bodhisattva practices all the perfections on all the ten levels.🔽

original: bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Because the Dashabhumika and other sutras say, “It is not that he does not practice the other perfections,” it explains that the bodhisattva must practice all the perfections on all the ten bodhisattva stages.

original: de bzhin du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gcig tu dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gcig tu dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Similarly, with regard to bodhisattvas who delight in the perfection of wisdom alone,🔽in the sutra called the Compendium of All Dharmas, which is an extensive sutra, it says, “Maitreya, for the sake of enlightenment, bodhisattvas should take up all six perfections.

original: yongs su rgyas pa'i mdo chos thams cad bsdus pa las byams pa gang yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug car gzung bar bya ba de la skyes bu blun po rnams ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams shes
analyzed: yongs su rgyas pa'i mdo chos thams cad bsdus pa las byams pa gang yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug car gzung bar bya ba de la skyes bu blun po rnams ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams shes
translated: In this regard, how do foolish people know

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la bslab par bya'i /
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la bslab par bya'i /
translated: that bodhisattvas should train only in the perfection of wisdom?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams kyis ci zhig bya zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams kyis ci zhig bya zhes zer zhing /
translated: What is the use of the remaining perfections?🔽Thus, he thinks that he should disparage the other perfections.

original: des pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag la smod pa nyid du sems par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: des pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag la smod pa nyid du sems par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyud las kyang /
translated: And the Tathāgatotpattisambhavasūtra says:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di ni snying rje chen po'i rtsa ba can /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di ni snying rje chen po'i rtsa ba can /
translated: This knowledge of a tathāgata is rooted in great compassion.

original: byang chub kyi rgyu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyu dang ldan pa /
translated: It is endowed with the cause of enlightenment.

original: thabs kyi mthar phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs kyi mthar phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It has perfected the method.

original: de bas na gnyis ka yang dus thams cad du bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis ka yang dus thams cad du bsten par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, both are to be relied upon at all times.

original: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One’s nonabiding nirvāṇa is accomplished.

original: de yang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyis gzugs kyi sku dang zhing dang 'khor la sogs pa longs spyod chen po'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin par mdzad pas /
analyzed: de yang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyis gzugs kyi sku dang zhing dang 'khor la sogs pa longs spyod chen po'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin par mdzad pas /
translated: And by means of the skillful means of generosity and so forth, they fully acquire the perfect result of great wealth, the buddha bodies, the buddha fields, the retinue and so forth.🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas par mi mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas par mi mdzad do //
translated: Moreover, the Bhagavat does not remain in nirvana because he possesses the perfect result of great enjoyment, such as the form body, the buddhaverse, the retinue and so on, through the method of generosity and so on.

original: shes rab kyis phyin ci log ma lus par spangs pas 'khor bar gnas par mi mdzad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyis phyin ci log ma lus par spangs pas 'khor bar gnas par mi mdzad de /
translated: He does not remain in samsara because he has abandoned all error through wisdom,

original: 'khor ba ni phyin ci log gi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni phyin ci log gi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for samsara is characterized by error.

original: de yang chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis ni chos rnams kyang spang bar bya na chos ma yin pa lta ci smos zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu yin /
analyzed: de yang chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis ni chos rnams kyang spang bar bya na chos ma yin pa lta ci smos zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu yin /
translated: Moreover, those who know the Dharma to be like a raft should abandon the Dharma, not to mention that which is not Dharma.

original: de la phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa spang @77b bar bya'o zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: de la phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa spang @77b bar bya'o zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: There it is said that one should abandon attachment to error.

original: dgos pa'i don rdzogs par bya ba'i don du yang gnas par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa'i don rdzogs par bya ba'i don du yang gnas par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is said,

original: de yang chos su gzung bar bya'i /🔽mi gzung bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang chos su gzung bar bya'i / mi gzung bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: One should hold to the Dharma,🔽but not hold to the person.

original: lam log pas gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lam log pas gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not hold to the person as a false guide.

original: de bas na dngos po thams cad de ltar gzigs te gsungs pa ni //🔽dus kun du ni thabs dang ni //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po thams cad de ltar gzigs te gsungs pa ni // dus kun du ni thabs dang ni //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha, seeing and teaching all things in that way,🔽Always with method and wisdom

original: shes rab pha rol phyin bdag can //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin bdag can //
translated: As his nature,

original: bsten bya gang phyir de las ni //
analyzed: bsten bya gang phyir de las ni //
translated: Is to be relied upon, because from him

original: mi gnas mya ngan 'das par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas mya ngan 'das par 'gyur // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Non-abiding nirvana comes.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa'i man ngag slob dpon chen po dpal ye shes grags pa'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa'i man ngag slob dpon chen po dpal ye shes grags pa'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The instruction on the stages of meditation of the perfection vehicle composed by the great master glorious Jñāna-prajñā is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po padma k'a ra warma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po padma k'a ra warma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //
translated: bhikṣu Rinchen Zangpo, translated and finalized this text.
